Title: Disney to Close ‘Star Wars’-Themed Hotel Less Than Two Years After It Opened
Author: Lauren McCarthy
Blurb: The planned closure of Galactic Starcruiser, an immersive role-playing attraction, comes as Disney seeks to cut overall costs by more than $5 billion.

Title: Behind the Scenes, G7 Nations Wrangle Over Ambitious Climate Commitments
Author: Motoko Rich, Lisa Friedman and Jim Tankersley
Blurb: The U.S. finds itself caught between defending President Biden’s climate change agenda and aiding allies intent on increasing their access to fossil fuels.

Title: DeSantis Lawyers Ask Judge in Disney Case to Recuse Himself
Author: Brooks Barnes
Blurb: They argued that Judge Mark E. Walker’s comments in two unrelated proceedings displayed a bias toward the company.

Title: JetBlue-American Partnership Struck Down by Federal Judge
Author: Joe Rennison and Niraj Chokshi
Blurb: An alliance begun in 2021 at four airports in the New York area and Boston allowed the airlines to sell tickets on each other’s flights and share revenue.

Title: In a Sharp Reversal, Biden Opens a Path for Ukraine to Get Fighter Jets
Author: David E. Sanger, Jim Tankersley, Michael Crowley and Eric Schmitt
Blurb: The president told allied leaders that he would allow Ukrainian pilots to be trained on American-made F-16s, and is prepared to approve other countries’ transferring the jets to Ukraine.

Title: Powell Says Inflation Remains Too High
Author: Alan Rappeport and Joe Rennison
Blurb: The Fed chair said that it would take “some time” for inflation to moderate and that the central bank would continue to look at data as it considers whether to raise rates next month.

Title: James Gorman, Morgan Stanley’s Long-Serving C.E.O., Will Step Down Within a Year
Author: Rob Copeland
Blurb: A successor to Mr. Gorman has not been identified, but he said there were three internal candidates.

Title: China’s Tech Giants Signal the First Steps in a Bumpy Recovery
Author: Chang Che
Blurb: The economy is open again, helping Alibaba, Baidu and Tencent claw back in the first quarter from a miserable 2022, though they are likely to face continuing skepticism from investors.

Title: NASA Picks Blue Origin’s Blue Moon Lander for Artemis V Mission
Author: Kenneth Chang
Blurb: After losing out to SpaceX, Jeff Bezos’ rocket company will get a chance to carry astronauts to the moon’s surface on a mission scheduled for 2029.

Title: 1 in 5 Young Chinese Is Jobless, and Millions More Are About to Graduate
Author: Claire Fu
Blurb: The youth unemployment rate, which spiked during the pandemic, reached a record high this week, showing the perils of China’s uneven economic recovery.

Title: Volkswagen Sells Its Russia Operations, Including an Assembly Plant
Author: Melissa Eddy
Blurb: The German automaker, which quit making cars in Russia after the invasion of Ukraine, said it had sold its plant to a local auto dealership chain.

Title: Disney Inflicts a Blow to DeSantis Ahead of His Presidential Run
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: The entertainment giant’s move to cancel a major office project stung the Florida governor just days before he is expected to officially enter the 2024 race.

Title: Amazon Is Everywhere. That’s What Makes It So Vulnerable.
Author: Noam Scheiber
Blurb: For years, the e-commerce giant could shield its vast archipelago of warehouses against disruptions from workers. Then it got even bigger.

Title: ‘Movie Theaters Are the Marketplace of Free Ideas’
Author: Nicole Sperling
Blurb: John Fithian spent nearly three decades as the top lobbyist for movie theaters. He says their future is bright, despite the power of streaming.

Title: America’s Semiconductor Boom Faces a Challenge: Not Enough Workers
Author: Madeleine Ngo
Blurb: Strengthened by billions of federal dollars, semiconductor companies plan to create thousands of jobs. But officials say there might not be enough people to fill them.

Title: To Counter China, G7 Countries Borrow Its Economic Playbook
Author: Jim Tankersley and Ana Swanson
Blurb: Wealthy democracies rev up an effort to spend trillions on a new climate-friendly energy economy, while stealing away some of China’s manufacturing power.

Title: 15 Hours on the Job With a Bagel Roller
Author: Sarah Bahr
Blurb: A team of five reporters and video producers spent a day shadowing Celestino García for the Cooking team’s “On the Job” YouTube series.

Title: Kia and Hyundai to Pay $200 Million to Settle Suit Over Car Thefts
Author: Eduardo Medina
Blurb: The agreement in the class-action suit, which awaits a judge’s approval, would affect the owners of about nine million vehicles. It came as the nation contends with a surge in auto thefts.

Title: The Dawn of a New Century 21
Author: Emma Grillo
Blurb: The department store reopened in Lower Manhattan less than three years after closing all of its locations. For some, it had felt like an eternity.

Title: F.D.A. Panel Recommends R.S.V. Vaccine to Protect Young Infants
Author: Christina Jewett
Blurb: A committee of experts voted in favor of a new shot administered to pregnant women, one in a series of new ways to arm the very young against a life-threatening virus.

Title: Twitter Accuses Microsoft of Improperly Using Its Data
Author: Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Cade Metz
Blurb: In a letter to Microsoft’s chief executive, Satya Nadella, Twitter said the tech giant had violated a data agreement.

Title: Regulators Rebut Claims by Silicon Valley Bank’s Ex-C.E.O.
Author: Emily Flitter and Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The bank had not fixed its problems before it failed, they said. Its leader was not excluded from the sale process.

Title: Peter Thiel Is Latest Billionaire Said to Have Met With Jeffrey Epstein
Author: Matthew Goldstein and Ryan Mac
Blurb: Mr. Thiel apparently had several meetings with Mr. Epstein in 2014, according to records of the disgraced financier reviewed by The New York Times.

Title: TikTok Users Sue Montana, Calling State Ban Unconstitutional
Author: Sapna Maheshwari and David McCabe
Blurb: A spokeswoman for the state attorney general said that his office had “expected a legal challenge” and was “fully prepared to defend the law.”

Title: What Would Happen if the U.S. Defaulted on Its Debt
Author: Joe Rennison
Blurb: Investors, executives and economists are preparing contingency plans as they consider the turmoil that would result from a default in the $24 trillion U.S. Treasury market.

Title: Disney Pulls Plug on $1 Billion Development in Florida
Author: Brooks Barnes
Blurb: A new office complex, and relocation of a division from California, would have created more than 2,000 jobs but was scuttled as the company and Gov. Ron DeSantis continue to feud.

Title: Elizabeth Holmes Must Report to Prison on May 30 and Pay Restitution
Author: Lora Kelley
Blurb: The Theranos founder, who was convicted last year of defrauding investors, lost her bid to remain free on bail while she appeals her conviction.

Title: OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT App for the iPhone
Author: Cade Metz
Blurb: OpenAI is aiming to build on the popularity of its chatbot with a smartphone app that responds to voice prompts.

Title: Sam Zell, 81, Tycoon Whose Big Newspaper Venture Went Bust, Dies
Author: Robert D. McFadden
Blurb: With a fortune made in real estate, he went into the media business in a landmark leveraged buyout of the Tribune Company in 2007. Bankruptcy ensued.

Title: England’s Water Companies Vow to Clean Up Their Sewage Dumping Act
Author: Isabella Kwai
Blurb: Private firms apologized for not doing more to prevent the release of untreated sewage into rivers and seas and pledged to invest 10 billion pounds to fix the problem.

Title: Extremism Finds Fertile Ground in Chat Rooms for Gamers
Author: Steven Lee Myers and Kellen Browning
Blurb: In the past year, about half the people who played online multiplayer games in the world’s major gaming markets encountered extremist statements, a new study found.

Title: Unions Accuse UPMC of Wielding Market Power Against Workers
Author: Reed Abelson
Blurb: A coalition of unions has filed an antitrust complaint with the Justice Department, accusing the Pennsylvania hospital system of suppressing wages and worsening working conditions.

Title: When Will the U.S. Run Out of Cash? The Answer Is Complicated.
Author: Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The federal government is essentially living paycheck to paycheck, making the X-date hard to pin down.

Title: Corporate America Faces a Bankruptcy Boom
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: New data shows that 2023 is shaping up to be the biggest year for Chapter 11 filings in more than a decade.

Title: Walmart Raises Its Outlook as Shoppers Look for Bargains
Author: Jordyn Holman
Blurb: The retailer reported revenue that beat expectations and said it expected net sales to rise 3.5 percent for the year.

Title: In Battle Over A.I., Meta Decides to Give Away Its Crown Jewels
Author: Cade Metz and Mike Isaac
Blurb: The tech giant has publicly released its latest A.I. technology so people can build their own chatbots. Rivals like Google say that approach can be dangerous.

Title: It’s Not Your Imagination: First Class Is Getting Bigger
Author: Julie Weed
Blurb: Aiming to boost revenue and cater to a rising number of passengers willing to pay for premium seats, airlines are reconfiguring cabins and flying larger planes.

Title: An Untested Oil Price Cap Has Helped Choke Revenue to Russia
Author: Jim Tankersley
Blurb: Group of 7 leaders are prepared to celebrate the results of a novel effort to stabilize global oil markets and punish Moscow.

Title: The Scramble to Take Over What Bed Bath & Beyond Left Behind
Author: Jordyn Holman
Blurb: Couples are racing to find new wedding registries while suppliers seek other customers and competing retailers pledge to accept that big blue coupon.

Title: An Automaker Has a Stark Warning for the U.K. Car Industry
Author: Stanley Reed
Blurb: Stellantis said post-Brexit export rules and the lack of a domestic battery manufacturer could force it to close its plants in Britain.

Title: Deutsche Bank Will Pay $75 Million to Victims of Jeffrey Epstein
Author: Matthew Goldstein
Blurb: A proposed court settlement closes another chapter in the German bank’s relationship with the disgraced financier, which began in 2013 and continued up until late 2018.

Title: Montana Governor Signs Total Ban of TikTok in the State
Author: Sapna Maheshwari
Blurb: The legislation is the most extreme prohibition of the app in the nation and will almost certainly face legal challenges.

Title: Robert E. Lucas Jr., Nobel-Winning Conservative Economist, Dies at 85
Author: Sam Roberts
Blurb: Challenging the theories of John Maynard Keynes, he questioned the idea that government intervention could help steer the economy.

Title: Two Television Showrunners on ‘Creative Short Circuits’
Author: Reggie Ugwu
Blurb: Soo Hugh (“Pachinko”) and Damon Lindelof (“Lost,” “Mrs. Davis”) discuss learning from their staffs, wanting to hear “no” and navigating the writers’ strike.

Title: Haven’t Checked Your Gmail in a While? Google May Delete Your Account.
Author: Jesus Jiménez
Blurb: Personal Google accounts that have not been used in at least two years could be removed starting in December as part of an effort to address security threats, the company said.

Title: For Biden, Crisis at Home Complicates Diplomacy Abroad
Author: Peter Baker
Blurb: Volatility has become the new norm in Washington as the president heads to Japan, where he will reassure world leaders that the debt ceiling showdown will not upend the global economy.

Title: Kaitlan Collins, Moderator of Trump Forum, Is Named CNN’s 9 P.M. Anchor
Author: Michael M. Grynbaum
Blurb: The appointment caps a fast rise at the network by Ms. Collins, 31, who previously covered the Trump and Biden administrations.

Title: Washington Confronts the Challenge of Policing A.I.
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: Lawmakers and Sam Altman, the chief executive of OpenAI, agreed that artificial intelligence should be regulated. How to do that remains an open question.

Title: For Gen Z, Playing an Influencer on TikTok Comes Naturally
Author: Sapna Maheshwari
Blurb: There’s stuff to promote now. The followers can come later.

Title: As China Looms Over Taiwan’s Presidential Race, the Opposition Picks a Moderate
Author: John Liu and Paul Mozur
Blurb: The Kuomintang nominated Hou Yu-ih, a popular mayor who has said little about geopolitical issues, as the party tries to appeal to voters wary of Beijing.

Title: Burning Man Becomes Latest Adversary in Geothermal Feud
Author: Arielle Paul
Blurb: Festival organizers are trying to block plans to build a clean energy plant in the Nevada desert, highlighting the struggle to combat climate change and the cost of clean power.

Title: Drug Shortages Near an All-Time High, Leading to Rationing
Author: Christina Jewett
Blurb: A worrisome scarcity of cancer drugs has heightened concerns about the troubled generic drug industry. Congress and the White House are seeking ways to address widespread supply problems.

Title: Disney Argues New Florida Law Nullifies DeSantis-Backed Suit
Author: Brooks Barnes
Blurb: The company wants a state court case involving development at Disney World dismissed, saying actions by the Florida governor and his allies made it moot.

Title: Senators Grill Ex-C.E.O. of Silicon Valley Bank
Author: Reuters
Blurb: Lawmakers on the Senate Banking Committee derided claims by the former chief executive of Silicon Valley Bank, Gregory Becker, that unforeseeable circumstances led to the bank’s failure.

Title: Biden Vetoes Legislation That Would Reinstate Tariffs on Some Solar Panels
Author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
Blurb: President Biden announced a two-year pause on the tariffs last year after importers complained that the penalties would threaten broader adoption of solar energy in the United States.

Title: U.S. Tech Espionage Team Unveils First Cases Involving China and Russia
Author: Ana Swanson
Blurb: A new division set up by the government to pursue sanctions evasion and technology espionage announced arrests of individuals with ties to foreign governments.

Title: Silicon Valley Bank’s Ex-C.E.O. Is ‘Truly Sorry’ but Deflects Blame
Author: Rob Copeland
Blurb: Senators derided Gregory Becker at a hearing about the reasons for the failure of his bank. “It sounds a lot like ‘my dog ate my homework,’” one said.

Title: Strippers Unionize at California Club After Long Fight
Author: Noam Scheiber and Ava Sasani
Blurb: The club agreed not to block the dancers from affiliating with Actors’ Equity in what appears to be the industry’s first unionization since the 1990s.

Title: OpenAI C.E.O. Calls for Government Regulation of Artificial Intelligence
Author: Reuters
Blurb: Sam Altman, the chief executive of OpenAI, testified before lawmakers on the dangers and opportunities of artificial intelligence at a Senate subcommittee hearing.

Title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman Urges A.I. Regulation in Senate Hearing
Author: Cecilia Kang
Blurb: The tech executive and lawmakers agreed that new A.I. systems must be regulated. Just how that would happen is not yet clear.

Title: Electric Vans, Delayed by Production Problems, Find Eager Buyers
Author: Neal E. Boudette
Blurb: Passenger cars dominate the electric vehicle market, but light delivery trucks could benefit from the cost savings and range E.V.s offer.

Title: U.S. Sues to Block Amgen’s $27.8 Billion Takeover of Horizon Therapeutics
Author: Rebecca Robbins
Blurb: The Federal Trade Commission said the deal would enable Amgen to exploit its size to block competition for two expensive Horizon drugs.

Title: The C.E.O. of OpenAI Heads to Congress to Discuss Rules for A.I.
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: Sam Altman, who leads ChatGPT’s parent company, is expected to call for some regulation of artificial intelligence as Washington weighs its next steps.

Title: Microsoft Says New A.I. Shows Signs of Human Reasoning
Author: Cade Metz
Blurb: A provocative paper from researchers at Microsoft claims A.I. technology shows the ability to understand the way people do. Critics say those scientists are kidding themselves.

Title: Musk Warns Tesla Shareholders to Expect “Challenging” Year
Author: Jack Ewing
Blurb: Tesla will not escape the effects of a global economic downturn, Mr. Musk said at the carmaker’s annual meeting. But he insisted Tesla would emerge stronger.

Title: Can the World Make an Electric Car Battery Without China?
Author: Agnes Chang and Keith Bradsher
Blurb: From mines to refineries and factories, China began investing decades ago. Today, most of your electric car batteries are made in China and that’s unlikely to change soon.

Title: Wells Fargo to Pay $1 Billion to Settle Lawsuit by Shareholders
Author: John Yoon
Blurb: A group of shareholders had claimed that the bank misled investors about its progress in cleaning up after a sham accounts scandal a decade ago.

Title: Appeals Court Pauses Ruling That Threatened Free Preventive Health Care
Author: Emily Baumgaertner
Blurb: The action, which stayed a lower court ruling, will require health plans to fully cover preventive services while the appeals process plays out.

Title: Possible Cyberattack Disrupts The Philadelphia Inquirer
Author: Michael Levenson
Blurb: The Inquirer, citing “anomalous activity” on its computer systems, said it was unable to print its regular Sunday edition and told staff members not to work in the newsroom at least through Tuesday.

Title: Yellen Reiterates That the U.S. Could Run Out of Cash by June 1
Author: Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The latest warning to Congress came before another meeting on Tuesday between President Biden and Speaker Kevin McCarthy to resolve the debt ceiling crisis.

Title: The Restaurant Service Charge Isn’t Going Anywhere
Author: Priya Krishna
Blurb: These added-on fees confuse diners and even employees, but more owners are relying on them to help make a tough business work.

Title: Striking Hollywood Writers Disrupt TV’s Major Ad Event
Author: John Koblin
Blurb: Dozens of protesters greeted marketers as they entered the first major event of the upfronts, an annual showcase for advertisers in which media companies stage lavish gatherings to promote their lineups.

Title: San Francisco Fed Ties to S.V.B. Chief Attracts Scrutiny to Century-Old Setup
Author: Jeanna Smialek
Blurb: As Greg Becker, the former C.E.O. of Silicon Valley Bank, prepares to testify before Congress, boards that oversee regional Federal Reserve branches are in the spotlight.

Title: I.R.S. Acknowledges Black Americans Face More Audit Scrutiny
Author: Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The commissioner, Daniel Werfel, said the agency was working to correct unfairness in the enforcement of the tax code.

Title: Cyclone Mocha Leaves Thousands Homeless in Bangladesh and Myanmar
Author: Saif Hasnat and Suhasini Raj
Blurb: There was less damage than predicted, but the Rohingya refugee camps on the coast of Bangladesh, where most live in simple shanties, were hit particularly hard.

Title: E.U. Approves Microsoft’s $69 Billion Deal for Activision
Author: Adam Satariano
Blurb: The green light follows objections to the blockbuster deal by American and British regulators on the grounds that it would undercut competition.

Title: The $69 Billion Microsoft-Activision Deal Faces a Big E.U. Test
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: The bloc’s antitrust regulators could side with Microsoft on Monday, but the tech giant still faces an uphill battle to gaining full  approval.

Title: U.S.-Made Technology Is Flowing to Russian Airlines, Despite Sanctions
Author: Ana Swanson and Niraj Chokshi
Blurb: Russian customs data shows that millions of dollars of aircraft parts made by Boeing, Airbus and others were sent to Russia last year.

Title: Hotels Roll Out the Red Carpet for Pets
Author: Stephanie Rosenbloom
Blurb: Doggy menus, plush beds, nose balm and pet sitting: As people increasingly travel with their four-legged friends, hotels are stepping up with more amenities.

Title: Why Some Countries Find It Hard to Move Away From Fossil Fuels
Author: Clifford Krauss
Blurb: Trinidad and Tobago is the No. 2 exporter of liquefied natural gas in the Americas. Its output has been falling, but it remains committed to fossil fuels.

Title: Climate Change Brings Warmer, Wetter Weather to Trinidad
Author: Clifford Krauss
Blurb: Even as the leaders of Trinidad and Tobago double down on fossil fuels, climate change is bringing more extreme weather to the island nation.

Title: Vice, Decayed Digital Colossus, Files for Bankruptcy
Author: Lauren Hirsch and Benjamin Mullin
Blurb: Vice, which had wooed media giants, has struggled to adjust to the punishing realities of digital publishing. A group of creditors could buy Vice for $225 million.

Title: Bill Oesterle, Co-Founder of Angie’s List, Dies at 57
Author: Daniel E. Slotnik
Blurb: What began as a company to review local contractors grew into a website with millions of subscribers looking to make home improvements.

Title: Who Would Want to Be a C.E.O.?
Author: Ravi Mattu
Blurb: The challenges facing business leaders feel particularly acute right now. This week, DealBook delved into four of them.

Title: The Week in Business: Trump on TV
Author: Marie Solis
Blurb: Inflation continues to slow. Elon Musk says he’s found a new C.E.O. for Twitter. And there will be a pair of Senate hearings on the banking crisis.

Title: The Greatest Wealth Transfer in History Is Here, With Familiar (Rich) Winners
Author: Talmon Joseph Smith and Karl Russell
Blurb: In an era of surging home and stock values, U.S. family wealth has soared. The trillions of dollars going to heirs will largely reinforce inequality.

Title: You Can Ignore the Bridezilla in the Breakroom
Author: Roxane Gay
Blurb: A colleague’s wedding — even if she won’t stop talking about it — doesn’t mean you need to spend money you don’t want to spend.

Title: What’s the Point of Your 20s? Ask the Patron Saint of Striving Youth.
Author: Emma Goldberg
Blurb: Meg Jay knows it’s confusing to figure out what to do with your life. She also knows you need to get on with it.

Title: Biden Wants Airlines to Pay Passengers for Delays. In Europe, they already do
Author: Bernhard Warner and Sarah Kessler
Blurb: The E.U.’s passenger rights law has changed how airlines schedule flights.

Title: The Florida Man of Formula 1
Author: Michael M. Grynbaum
Blurb: Logan Sargeant is F1’s first full-time American driver since 2007. Can his sport make the leap from Monte Carlo to Miami with its soul intact?

Title: Why Some Companies Are Saying ‘Diversity and Belonging’ Instead of ‘Diversity and Inclusion’
Author: Jennifer Miller
Blurb: The changing terminology reflects new thinking among some consultants, who say traditional D.E.I. strategies haven’t worked out as planned.

Title: Divorce Can Wreck a Woman’s Financial Future. Here’s How to Rebuild.
Author: Lela Nargi
Blurb: Women who have gone through a divorce often see their savings and retirement depleted. Building back means careful planning.

Title: Flush With Federal Money, Strings Attached, a Deep South Factory Votes to Unionize
Author: Jonathan Weisman
Blurb: Friday’s victory by the United Steelworkers at a factory building electric school buses was a test for Democratic hopes that clean-energy funding from Washington could bolster organized labor.

Title: Some U.S. Solar Makers Criticize Biden’s Tax Credits as Too Lax on China
Author: Ana Swanson, Alan Rappeport and Ivan Penn
Blurb: U.S.-based manufacturers of solar products say rules issued by the Biden administration on Friday will “cement China’s dominance” over the solar industry.

Title: F.D.A. Approves New Drug to Treat Hot Flashes
Author: Christina Jewett
Blurb: It is the first nonhormonal treatment for the menopause symptom.

Title: Bernadine Strik, Whose Insights Helped Blueberries Thrive, Dies at 60
Author: Daniel E. Slotnik
Blurb: A horticulturist, she discovered farming methods that increased yields of the fruit as its health benefits became widely understood and demand for it grew.

Title: Mike Pride, Who Proved a Regional Newspaper Could Work, Dies at 76
Author: Sam Roberts
Blurb: For 25 years he was editor of The Concord Monitor, an award-winning go-to source every four years for national reporters covering the New Hampshire presidential primary.

Title: Ex-ByteDance Executive Accuses Company of ‘Lawlessness’
Author: Thomas Fuller and Sapna Maheshwari
Blurb: The former executive sued ByteDance, which owns TikTok, for wrongful termination and accused the company of lifting content from rivals and “supreme access” by the Chinese Communist Party.

Title: In China, the Police Came for the Consultants. Now the C.E.O.s Are Alarmed.
Author: Daisuke Wakabayashi, Ana Swanson and Lauren Hirsch
Blurb: Foreign businesses, a top Chinese official said in March, “are not foreigners, but family.” Then came a crackdown on firms with foreign ties.

Title: The Business Nightmare of Dealing with Government
Author: Matthew Gwyther
Blurb: The rise of populism is testing corporations’ relationships with policymakers, but it’s hard for C.E.O.s to engage without getting clobbered.

Title: Your Stories: Cool, Fascinating and Fun Climate Jobs
Author: Manuela Andreoni
Blurb: We asked you to tell us about your careers. You had plenty to say.

Title: U.S. Faces ‘Significant Risk’ of Running Out of Cash in June, Budget Office Warns
Author: Alan Rappeport
Blurb: A default would cause financial distress, economic disruptions and rapid increases in borrowing rates, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said.

Title: White House Taps Two Economists for Top Fed Jobs
Author: Jeanna Smialek
Blurb: President Biden announced his plan to nominate Adriana Kugler, an official at the World Bank, for a Fed governor job, while elevating Philip Jefferson to the role of vice chair.

Title: Elon Musk Appoints Linda Yaccarino Twitter’s New Chief
Author: Tiffany Hsu, Sapna Maheshwari, Benjamin Mullin and Ryan Mac
Blurb: Mr. Musk said Ms. Yaccarino would focus on business operations and he would work on product design and technology at the social media platform.

Title: More Options to Pay for Medical Care, but Some May Be Costly
Author: Ann Carrns
Blurb: Consumer experts are warning patients that some offerings charge much higher interest rates than regular credit cards.

Title: Calls to Investigate Short Sellers Intensify as Bank Crisis Deepens
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: Jamie Dimon is the latest to urge action against the traders who have targeted the regional lenders and made huge profits.

Title: China Orders Tesla to Recall 1.1 Million Vehicles Over Braking Risks
Author: Jenny Gross and Claire Fu
Blurb: Defects on certain Tesla models could lead drivers to step on the accelerator pedals for longer than necessary, increasing the risk of collisions, China’s market regulator says.

Title: How the Last Writers’ Strike Changed Things Onscreen
Author: Nicole Sperling
Blurb: The impact included promising shows that lost their audiences, films rushed into production with flimsy scripts and turbocharging reality programming.

Title: The Debt Ceiling Dispute Raises the Risks for ‘Risk-Free’ U.S. Bonds
Author: Jeff Sommer
Blurb: Short-term costs for insuring U.S. bonds are skyrocketing, and the long-term effects of repeated flirtations with debt default are already a burden, our columnist says.

Title: Once an Evangelist for Airbnbs, She Now Crusades for Affordable Housing
Author: Martha C. White
Blurb: Precious Price ditched her profitable business  of renting home stays to tourists to combat the mounting housing crisis.

Title: How a Solo Gig Can Give You a Stronger Retirement
Author: Mark Miller
Blurb: Becoming a solo entrepreneur in the years after leaving an employer can give your Social Security benefit and savings a boost. Here’s what to know.

Title: Help! My Tour Got Canceled but Travel Insurance Won’t Pay
Author: Seth Kugel
Blurb: Destruction from Hurricane Ian led a tour operator to cancel a 10-day excursion to Cuba, leaving a woman with a useless $1,500 plane ticket. That’s what travel insurance is for, right? Our columnist dives into the red tape.

Title: Britain’s Economy Ekes Out Growth in First Quarter
Author: Eshe Nelson
Blurb: The increase of 0.1 percent in the three months that ended in March, which was driven by construction and information services, matched the slow rise in the previous quarter.

Title: Kemal Dervis, Who Eased Turkey’s Economic Crisis, Dies at 74
Author: Neil Genzlinger
Blurb: Changes he spearheaded in 2001 helped avert disaster. He later led the United Nations Development Program.

Title: Meeting Between Biden and Republicans Delayed as Sides Pursue Debt Limit Deal
Author: Carl Hulse, Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The decision to delay Friday’s expected meeting to next week was cast as a positive development, one that could allow officials to find agreement before the United States defaults on its debt.

Title: Elon Musk Says He Has a New C.E.O. for Twitter
Author: Benjamin Mullin, Ryan Mac and Tiffany Hsu
Blurb: Mr. Musk is in talks about the role with Linda Yaccarino, chairman of global advertising and partnerships at NBCUniversal, two people with knowledge of the matter said.

Title: Striking Writers Find Their Villain: Netflix
Author: John Koblin and Nicole Sperling
Blurb: Fear of protests prompted the streaming giant to shift an anticipated presentation for advertisers to a virtual event and a top executive to skip an honorary gala.

Title: Peloton Shares Slide After It Recalls Two Million Exercise Bikes
Author: Lora Kelley
Blurb: The company is offering to replace seat posts on the bikes after receiving 35 reports of the equipment breaking.

Title: F.D.A. Eases Ban on Blood Donations From Gay and Bisexual Men
Author: Christina Jewett
Blurb: But men who had multiple sex partners or were taking PrEP medications in the last three months would still be barred from donating blood.

Title: Back-to-Office Battles Underscore a Change in Workplace Authority
Author: Stefan Stern
Blurb: As workers push back on mandates, business leaders are wrestling with a new, post-pandemic identity.

Title: How MTV Broke News for a Generation
Author: Remy Tumin
Blurb: MTV News bridged a gap between news and pop culture without talking down to its young audience. As it prepares to shut down, Kurt Loder, Tabitha Soren, Sway Calloway and others reflect on its legacy.

Title: PacWest Bank, Shedding Billions in Deposits, Enters Renewed Market Spiral
Author: Rob Copeland
Blurb: The Los Angeles-based lender said that its falling stock price ignited customers’ “fears of the safety of their deposits.”

Title: CNN Chairman Defends Decision to Host Trump Town Hall
Author: Michael M. Grynbaum and Benjamin Mullin
Blurb: “People woke up, and they know what the stakes are in this election in a way that they didn’t the day before,” Chris Licht said in a morning call at the network.

Title: Why You’re Probably Hearing Less About Corporate Climate Initiatives
Author: Michael Skapinker
Blurb: Amid accusations of “greenwashing” and “woke capitalism,” some business advisers say staying quiet might be the best option.

Title: Yellen Calls Invoking 14th Amendment to Raise Debt Limit ‘Legally Questionable’
Author: Alan Rappeport
Blurb: The Treasury secretary warned that a default would lead to a “very substantial downturn.”

Title: How FTX Missed a Potentially Lucrative Opportunity
Author: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
Blurb: A decision to offload warrants to buy an obscure cryptocurrency token as part of the exchange’s bankruptcy proceedings may have been costly.

Title: Bank of England Raises Interest Rates to Highest Level in 15 Years
Author: Eshe Nelson
Blurb: The central bank lifted its benchmark rate a quarter point, to 4.5 percent, as part of its aggressive policy to tame inflation, but forecast that Britain was likely to avoid a recession.

Title: U.S. Focuses on Invigorating ‘Chiplets’ to Stay Cutting-Edge in Tech
Author: Don Clark
Blurb: Chiplets, a way to design chips for higher performance, has become a key prong of U.S. industrial policy. But pushing for more of this activity domestically is challenging.

Title: Friends Once ‘Escaped’ Her Cooking. Now, She’s One of the World’s Best Chefs.
Author: Valeriya Safronova
Blurb: Ana Ros broke through the boys’ club of fine dining, earning Hisa Franko in Slovenia two Michelin stars and a spot on the list of the world’s best restaurants.

Title: How Russia’s Rich Get Their Luxuries Now
Author: Anton Troianovski and Jack Ewing
Blurb: More than a year into Vladimir Putin’s invasion, the web of global trade has adjusted to Western sanctions, with a network of middlemen sending cars, electronics and more to Russia.

Title: Taiwan Is Running Low on a Strategic Asset: Engineers
Author: John Liu and Paul Mozur
Blurb: Taiwan’s world-dominating microchip sector was built by TSMC’s skilled employees. But a demographic crisis, demanding work culture and flagging interest threaten its lead.

Title: CNN’s Trump Forum Was a Combative Preview of Political Coverage to Come
Author: Michael M. Grynbaum
Blurb: Criticized for handing Donald Trump a live prime-time platform, CNN faced a divisive response to an occasionally bewildering broadcast.

Title: Chris Strachwitz, Who Dug Up the Roots of American Music, Dies at 91
Author: Alex Traub
Blurb: Traveling the nation to discover little-known performers for the Arhoolie label, which he founded in 1960, he earned a nickname: El Fanático.

Title: Addiction Treatment Medicine Is Vastly Underprescribed, Especially by Race, Study Finds
Author: Jan Hoffman
Blurb: Black patients with opioid use disorder were far less likely to fill prescriptions for the most effective addiction treatments than white patients. But strikingly few patients of all races got the medicine.

Title: New Defamation Suit Against Fox Signals Continued Legal Threat
Author: Jim Rutenberg and Steven Lee Myers
Blurb: The suit, brought by a specialist in Russian disinformation, cites parallels with the recently settled Dominion Voting Systems case against Fox.

Title: How Past Debt Limit Crises Shaped Biden’s No-Negotiation Stance
Author: Katie Rogers
Blurb: Battles in 2011 and 2013 taught President Biden not to lean on a House speaker who has little room to negotiate and to keep debt ceiling talks separate from the budget.

Title: Disney’s Losses From Streaming Narrowed in the Last Quarter
Author: Brooks Barnes
Blurb: The company’s earnings were buoyed by its theme parks and cruise ships. It also announced it would soon put Hulu content on Disney+.

Title: F.B.I. Says Video Voyeur Hid Camera in Cruise Ship Bathroom
Author: Ceylan Yeginsu
Blurb: The bureau arrested a passenger aboard the Harmony of the Seas for allegedly recording more than 150 passengers, including 40 minors, in a public bathroom.

Title: Carl Icahn’s Firm Faces Federal Inquiry
Author: Maureen Farrell and Matthew Goldstein
Blurb: The billionaire activist investor’s company said that U.S. prosecutors had asked for information about its operations after a short seller’s report took aim at the way the firm is run.

Title: F.D.A. Advisers Say Benefits of Over-the-Counter Birth Control Pill Outweigh Risks
Author: Pam Belluck
Blurb: The agency is expected to decide this summer whether to allow the first nonprescription sales of an oral contraceptive in the United States.
